sources.title: The Detached Mission
sources.description:
A Soviet action film directed by Mikhail Tumanishvili. The leader of the Soviet film distribution in 1986. The adventure film tells about the feat of Soviet sailors who prevented a nuclear catastrophe. One of the first films of the "action" genre in Soviet cinema.

Year of production: 1985

Director: Tumanishvili Mikhail
Writer: Mesyatsev Evgeny
Composer: Babushkin Viktor
Camera operator: Bondarenko Boris
Production designers: Lapshina Tatyana, Myagkov Alexander

Cast: Fatyushin Alexander, Nozhkin Mikhail, Nasibov Sergey, Begalin Nartai, Zikora Vitaly, Licitis Arnis, Vats Kirill, Vinogradov Valerian, Volkosh Sergey, Golubitsky Oleg, Izotova Veronika, Kolganov Yuri, Kurnakov Nikolay, Lavrov Nikolay, Melderis Yanis, Ogorodnikov Boris

metadata.Plot: This 1985 action-adventure film pits a detachment of Soviet naval infantry (equivalent of the U.S. Marine Corps in the Soviet Union) against the CIA, U.S. Army, Air Force, and Navy. A CIA operation to prevent a summit that threatens to undermine profits of defense contractors goes awry, and Major Shatokhin of the Soviet naval infantry has to lead his men on a mission to prevent World War III.
metadata.Actors: Mikhail Nozhkin, Aleksandr Fatyushin, Sergey Nasibov
